abstract: Hong Kong democracy activists Joshua Wong and Martin Lee, visiting United States, urge Obama administration to press China on human rights issues; further request that United States push Chinese Pres Xi Jinping to give Hong Kong all of the democratic rights it was promised in 1997 when Great Britain returned the territory to China.
lead_paragraph: Joshua Wong, 18, and Martin Lee, 77, said in an interview that President Obama should press their cause when meeting his Chinese counterpart this week.

headline.main: Two Activists Visiting U.S. Call for Rights in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Two Activists Visiting U.S. Call for Rights in Hong Kong

snippet: Joshua Wong, 18, and Martin Lee, 77, said in an interview that President Obama should press their cause when meeting his Chinese counterpart this week.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
